senses.de: the standard of something when compared to things of a similar kind
senses.ex: The quality of her work is very high.

Tips.title: Comparative Assessment
Tips.description: Used when evaluating something by comparing it to similar things to judge its level.
Tips.example: The quality of this smartphone is better than others in its price range.

Tips.title: Not Always Visible
Tips.description: Quality can refer to intangible attributes that aren't immediately obvious.
Tips.example: This car's quality lies in its safety features and durability.

Tips.title: Subjective Nature
Tips.description: Perception of quality may vary from person to person, as it's subjective.
Tips.example: Some people prize the quality of simplicity in design over complexity.

senses.de: a feature or characteristic belonging to someone or something
senses.ex: He has several good qualities, such as kindness and generosity.

Tips.title: Describing Characteristics
Tips.description: Highlights specific traits of a person or object, can be positive or negative.
Tips.example: Resilience is a quality I admire in my role models.

Tips.title: Implicit Value
Tips.description: Certain qualities might suggest a hidden value that's not directly stated.
Tips.example: The handcrafted vase has a quality of authenticity to it.

Tips.title: Personal and Unique
Tips.description: Some qualities are inherent, making them unique to individuals or objects.
Tips.example: The quality of her voice is what sets her apart from other singers.

senses.de: the degree of excellence of something
senses.ex: Our goal is to improve the quality of our products.

Tips.title: Degree of Excellence
Tips.description: Refers to how good something is, often suggesting superiority.
Tips.example: Michelin-starred restaurants are known for their food's quality.

Tips.title: Expectation Indicator
Tips.description: Use 'quality' to set expectations regarding the performance or experience.
Tips.example: Guests will enjoy the quality of our five-star hotel services.

Tips.title: Beyond Basics
Tips.description: Quality often implies more than basic functions, adding to desirability or value.
Tips.example: Her dress wasn't just functional; its quality was in the fine details.

Attribute.wordDefinition:
Attribute and quality are words that are often used interchangeably, but they have slightly different meanings.

Attribute refers to a characteristic or feature that something or someone possesses. For example, if you are describing a person, you might say that they have attributes such as honesty, intelligence, or athleticism.

In a similar way, you might describe an object or product by its attributes, such as its size, weight, or color. Attributes are objective and measurable, meaning they can be quantified and observed.

Quality is often more difficult to quantify or measure than attributes, and it is influenced by personal preferences and opinions.

However, you would typically use attribute when you want to describe a specific characteristic or feature of something, while quality emphasizes the overall level of excellence or goodness.

Character.wordDefinition:
Character refers to a person's traits that define their personality, behavior, and values. For example, honesty, integrity, and compassion are all aspects of someone's character.

Character is often used when talking about people and their traits, while quality is often used when discussing products or services.

However, both words can also be used in a broader sense. For example, someone might say that a company's customer service is of high quality, or that a person's character is of poor quality.

Excellence.wordDefinition:
Excellence and quality are both about being really good at something, but there is a subtle difference between them.

Excellence refers to exceeding expectations and constantly improving to be the best at a particular task or activity. It is about setting really high standards for oneself and working hard to achieve them.

For example, if you aim for excellence in basketball, you would practice every day and work on improving your skills constantly, to perform to the best of your ability in every game.

Excellence is about aspiring to be the best and constantly improving, while quality is about meeting a particular level of expectation and standard.

Feature.wordDefinition:
Feature refers to a particular characteristic or aspect of something, like the camera feature on a smartphone.

In everyday language, feature is often used when talking about the specific things that a product has or can do, while quality is used when discussing how well the product performs overall.

A feature could be something that sets a product apart or makes it more useful, while quality is an assessment of how good the product is in general.

For example, a car might have the feature of automatic windows or a backup camera, while its quality would be judged on factors such as reliability, safety, and comfort.

Grade.wordDefinition:
Grade refers to the level or standard of a particular thing or how well it performs a particular function. For example, in school, your grade is a measure of how well you did on a test or assignment compared to the standard that has been set for that task.

In industrial manufacturing, grades can be used to indicate the strength or durability of materials like steel or concrete.

Overall, grades focus on how well something meets a particular set of standards, while quality is more of a subjective judgment about how good something is overall.

Property.wordDefinition:
Property refers to a characteristic or trait that something possesses, such as color, size, shape, or texture.

Property is what something is, and quality is how well it works.

Standard.wordDefinition:
Standard refers to a set of guidelines or principles that are widely accepted or established. It is applicable to things like rules, regulations, or criteria.

For example, a company may have a standard policy that all employees must wear a uniform.

In simpler terms, quality is about how good something is, while standard is about the rules and expectations for that thing.

Trait.wordDefinition:
The words quality and trait are similar in meaning, but quality generally refers to a characteristic or feature of a thing, while trait refers to a characteristic or feature of a person or animal.

A person's trait may refer to their personality, such as being kind, generous, or intelligent.

Quality describes things while trait describes people or animals.

quotes.Text: It's obvious that the key problem facing humanity in the coming century is how to bring a better quality of life - for 8 billion or more people - without wrecking the environment entirely in the attempt.
quotes.Title: American Scientist
quotes.Name: E. O. Wilson

quotes.Text: The tears of the world are a constant quality. For each one who begins to weep, somewhere else another stops. The same is true of the laugh.
quotes.Title: Irish Playwright
quotes.Name: Samuel Beckett

quotes.Text: I am trying to show the world that we are all human beings and that color is not important. What is important is the quality of our work.
quotes.Title: American Dancer
quotes.Name: Alvin Ailey

quotes.Text: Every secret of a writer's soul, every experience of his life, every quality of his mind is written large in his works.
quotes.Title: British Author
quotes.Name: Virginia Woolf

quotes.Text: You will find as you grow older that courage is the rarest of all qualities to be found in public life.
quotes.Title: British Statesman
quotes.Name: Benjamin Disraeli

quotes.Text: Almost every man wastes part of his life attempting to display qualities which he does not possess.
quotes.Title: English Writer
quotes.Name: Samuel Johnson

quotes.Text: Courage is the first of human qualities because it is the quality which guarantees the others.
quotes.Title: Greek Philosopher
quotes.Name: Aristotle

quotes.Text: One of the most beautiful qualities of true friendship is to understand and to be understood.
quotes.Title: Roman Statesman
quotes.Name: Lucius Annaeus Seneca

quotes.Text: I don't have any health problems, but to keep your health improves your quality of life.
quotes.Title: American Musician
quotes.Name: Mary J. Blige
